Student Governance Student Perks and Discounts Graduate School Career and Professional Development Pathways to Success Free Memberships for Cornell Graduate Students and Postdocs Free Memberships for Cornell Graduate Students and Postdocs Free Individual Memberships with NCFDD Available to all Cornell students, postdocs, faculty, and staff Cornell is an institutional member of the NCFDD (formerly the National Center for Faculty Development & Diversity), a nationally recognized, independent organization providing online career development and mentoring resources. NCFDD provides members with access to tools to increase research and writing productivity and improve work-life balance. Activate your account by following the steps below: Go to the NCFDD website Under “Select Your Institution,” choose “Cornell University” Select “Activate my Membership” Complete the registration form using your Cornell email address Check your Cornell email account to find a confirmation/welcome email. Click “Activate Account” in the email Complimentary One-year Membership with New York Academy of Sciences (NYAS) Available to all Cornell students, postdocs, faculty, and staff Cornell University maintains an institutional membership with the New York Academy of Science (NYAS). Secure a sponsored membership with NYAS to access to various resources such as networking, resource building, and career readiness training. Activate your account by completing the Cornell specific membership form . Free Membership with ImaginePh.D. for Ph.D. Career Tools (Designed for Humanities and Social Sciences Graduate Students) Available to all Cornell students, postdocs, faculty, and staff ImaginePh.D. is a free online career exploration and planning tool for Ph.D. students and postdoctoral scholars in the humanities and social sciences. Cornell graduate students can 1) conduct online self-assessments to identify skills, interests, and values, 2) explore career paths, 3) develop next steps for career and professional development, and more. Activate your account on the ImaginePh.D. website . Free Access to Interstride for International Job Search Available to all Cornell students, postdocs, faculty, and staff Find job openings with U.S.-based international-friendly employers who have a demonstrated track-record of work visa sponsorship and CPT/OPT hiring. Workshops led by immigration experts help students to understand key information, including U.S. and Canadian work visas. Create your profile on the Interstride website . See more Cornell-subscribed career resources available to students. Institutional Membership with Center for the Integration of Research, Teaching, and Learning (CIRTL) Network Available to all Cornell graduate students, postdocs, faculty, and staff, plus Graduate School alumni and recent Cornell postdocs CIRTL is a North American future faculty preparation effort with branches at 40+ universities. Participate in webinars, online courses, and summer teaching institutes on diversity in the college classroom, Individual Development Plans (IDPs), the academic job search, and many additional topics on teaching and research mentoring. As a participant from a CIRTL Network member institution, your registration receives priority for any programs that are offered (as long as spots are available). Visit the CIRTL Network website for a full list of Upcoming Programs . Sign up for local Future Faculty and Academic Careers and/or national CIRTL Network news and events . Free Membership with the National Postdoctoral Association (NPA) Available to all Cornell graduate students, postdocs, faculty, and staff Cornell University is a sustaining member of the National Postdoctoral Association (NPA) . Founded in 2003, the NPA’s mission is “to advance the U.S. research enterprise by maximizing the effectiveness of the research community and enhancing the quality of the postdoctoral experience for all participants.” As part of a sustaining member institution, graduate students, postdocs, faculty, and staff are eligible for a free affiliate membership, which provides access to newsletters and members-only web content. Join the NPA by using your Cornell email address and selecting the corresponding “Affiliate Individual” option. Free Access to LinkedIn Learning with Lynda.com Available to all Cornell students, faculty, and staff LinkedIn Learning provides access to an online library of high-quality training videos featuring the latest software, creative, and business skills. Access over 11,000 online courses designed for all experience levels. Watch entire courses or individual video tutorials as you need them, and even access the LinkedIn Learning library 24/7 from your mobile device. LinkedIn Learning exercise files, project files, or other informational documents that an instructor uses to teach a course let you follow along with the instruction as you learn, and bookmarks help you keep track of what you’d like to watch later. Activate your account by signing into LinkedIn Learning with your LinkedIn login information. Free Subscription to Nature Masterclasses Available to all Cornell students, faculty, and staff All students, faculty, and staff can take any courses available through Nature Masterclasses including Scientific Writing and Publishing; Finding Funding Opportunities; Data Analysis; Networking for Researchers; and more. You must register your account using your Cornell email address. Land Acknowledgement Cornell University is located on the traditional homelands of the Gayogo̱hó꞉nǫ Ɂ (the Cayuga Nation). The Gayogo̱hó꞉nǫ Ɂ are members of the Hodinǫ̱hsǫ́:nih Confederacy, an alliance of six sovereign Nations with a historic and contemporary presence on this land. The Confederacy precedes the establishment of Cornell University, New York state, and the United States of America. We acknowledge the painful history of Gayogo̱hó꞉nǫ Ɂ dispossession, and honor the ongoing connection of Gayogo̱hó꞉nǫ Ɂ people, past and present, to these lands and waters. This land acknowledgment has been reviewed and approved by the traditional Gayogo̱hó꞉nǫ Ɂ leadership.
